@tai69

this is not a telesync.

your proof that this is a not a dvdrip seems to be "the dvd has not come out for legal public consumption yet" -- obviously, this does not constitute a logical citation of evidence.

by no means is this copy 10/10:a/v, but neither was the copy played in the theatre opening night in april on the "giant screen" (they gave us an imax theatre & just blew up the picture - you had to be a hardcore fan to find out that it was playing on a second screen & the regular one had already sold out).

& this copy is totally acceptable, compact, etc, & we can rewind when we laugh too hard to hear the next line, or when we just need to see one of the proper grindhouse slasher moments twice!

so @extremezone thank you again.  the only criticism i can offer is that i'm annoyed at the film being broken into two files.  however, i get the feeling that you have some reason, of which i'm not thinking, for doing this (i'd love if someone could explain it to me).

& at everyone else: please, please, please download & watch this amazing film.  if you're one of those who love it, show it to others & try your damnedest to show them why you / how to love it also.

and PLEASE remember to pay for a copy as soon as it is possible to do so.

with grim & bloody sincerity,
- ariel

Ok, all the people complaining about the movie being split into two parts.  The REAL reason it's done like this is so that you can fit the movie on a 700MB CD.  They've done movies like that for years.  Of course, people want higher quality movies now, so extremezone has doubled the video size, but still made it possible to fit the movie on standard sized CDs.

To join these two .avi files together just use Virtualdub. Thanks extremezone
